Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors

Interface DataConnectorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentInterface, ConnectorI, DataOfferedCI.PushCI, DataRequiredCI.PullCI, RequiredCI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataConnector, ActiveDataConnector, DataConnector
    public interface DataConnectorI
extends ConnectorI, DataRequiredCI.PullCI, DataOfferedCI.PushCI
    The interface DataConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others.

    Description

    The interfaces DataRequiredCI.PullCI and DataOfferedCI.PushCI contains methods that have different signatures, so that the connector know which way the calls are going. If extensions want to have part of their methods with the same signature, techniques similar to the ones used in data two way interfaces will be required to implement the connector. If the two interfaces need to be the same then data two way interfaces and connectors should be used instead.

    When components exchange data rather than calling services from each others, the offering component is considered as the producer of data while the requiring one is considered as the consumer. And the two interfaces are assumed to be developed independently, the data interfaces in the required and the offered interfaces need not be the same (not declare methods with the same signature). The connector is therefore responsible for the implementation of translating methods to and from.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
